title: 2018년 Daniel Jackson v. Shawn Curry 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Daniel Jackson v. Shawn Curry. 판결일: 2018-04-19. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Daniel JACKSON, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Shawn CURRY, Et Al., Defendants-Appellants.
**판결일**: 2018-04-19
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Bauer, Manion, Sykes

## 변호인

Steven Edwards Art, Attorney, Samuel D. Heppell, Attorney, Jon C. Loevy, Attorney, Elizabeth Mazur, Attorney, Loevy & Loevy, Chicago, IL, for Plaintiff-Appellee., Jeffrey R. Kivetz, Esq., Attorney, Joseph Polick, Attorney, James G. Sotos, Attorney, Sotos Law Firm, P.C., for Defendant-Appellant.

## 인용

- 888 F.3d 259

## 판결문 요약

                              In the

    United States Court of Appeals
                For the Seventh Circuit
                    ____________________
No. 17-1898
DANIEL JACKSON,
                                                  Plaintiff-Appellee,

                                v.

SHAWN CURRY, et al.,
                                            Defendants-Appellants.
                    ____________________

        Appeal from the United States District Court for the
                   Central District of Illinois.
             No. 16-cv-1054 — Sara Darrow, Judge.
                    ____________________

    ARGUED DECEMBER 7, 2017 — DECIDED APRIL 19, 2018
                    ____________________

   Before BAUER, MANION, and SYKES, Circuit Judges.
    MANION, Circuit Judge. Daniel Jackson spent time in
custody on a wrongful murder conviction. He sued Shawn
Curry and Keith McDaniel, the police officers who
interrogated him, for coercing his confession. The officers
moved for dismissal on qualified immunity. The district court
denied that motion, and the officers appeal. Lacking
jurisdiction, we dismiss this appeal.
 2                                                                No. 17-1898

                              I. Background 1
   On the night of August 29, 2009, Clifford Harvey, Jr., and
Easton Eibeck walked through Peoria, Illinois. Eibeck was
high. Four men confronted Harvey and Eibeck. When one of
the four reached for his waistband, Harvey and Eibeck ra...
